00025 #ifndef _BASE_MATRIX_
00026 #define _BASE_MATRIX_
00027 
00028 #include <base/base>
00029 
00030 #include <mtl/mtl.h>
00031 
00032 #include <base/Vector>
00033 
00034 
00035 namespace base {
00036 
00037 // The Matrix type is a RowMatrix (an array of row vectors)
00038 //  Use RowMatrix if this type is explicily needed (e.g. for constant-time row swaps)
00039 //  or  DenseMatrix if contigous storage is explicitly required
00040 
00041 typedef mtl::matrix<Real, mtl::rectangle<>, mtl::array< mtl::dense<> >, mtl::row_major>::type Matrix;
00042 typedef mtl::matrix<Real, mtl::rectangle<>, mtl::array< mtl::dense<> >, mtl::row_major>::type RowMatrix;
00043 typedef mtl::matrix<Real, mtl::rectangle<>, mtl::dense<>, mtl::row_major>::type               DenseMatrix;
00044 
00045 
00046 // Operators: These all assume mtl::dense<> - hopefully these won't be needed when the next
00047 // version of MTL is released with Expression templates (soon!)
00048 
00049 
00050 // MTL operators
00051 //
00052 //  (NB: these are all defined as templated on type T, rather than using
00053 //   Matrix & Vector explicitly, so that they also work for ExpressionMatrix
00054 //   & ExpressionVector [T=Expression] as well.)
00055 
00056 
00057 // A*x
00058 template <class T>
00059 inline mtl::dense1D<T> operator*(
00060                                  const typename mtl::matrix<T, mtl::rectangle<>, mtl::array<mtl::dense<> >, mtl::row_major>::type& A, 
00061                                  const mtl::dense1D<T>& x)
00062 {
00063   mtl::dense1D<T> r(x.size());
00064   mult(A,x,r);
00065   return r;
00066 }
00067 
00068 
00069 inline Vector operator*(const Matrix& A, const Vector& x)
00070 {
00071   Vector r(x.size());
00072   mult(A,x,r);
00073   return r;
00074 }
00075 
00076 
00077 
00078 // A*B
00079 template <class T>
00080 inline typename mtl::matrix<T, mtl::rectangle<>, mtl::array<mtl::dense<> >, mtl::row_major>::type 
00081   operator*(const typename mtl::matrix<T, mtl::rectangle<>, mtl::array<mtl::dense<> >, mtl::row_major>::type& A, 
00082             const typename mtl::matrix<T, mtl::rectangle<>, mtl::array<mtl::dense<> >, mtl::row_major>::type& B) 
00083 {
00084   typename mtl::matrix<T, mtl::rectangle<>, mtl::array<mtl::dense<> >, mtl::row_major>::type& C(A.nrows(),B.ncols());
00085   mult(A,B,C);
00086   return C;
00087 }
00088 
00089 
00090 inline Matrix operator*(const Matrix& A, const Matrix& B)
00091 {
00092   Matrix C(A.nrows(),B.ncols());
00093   mult(A,B,C);
00094   return C;
00095 }
00096 
00097 
00098 
00099 
00100 // make A the identity Matrix
00101 //  (is there a better way - or choice of name?)
00102 template<class T, class S>
00103 inline void setIdentity(typename mtl::matrix<T, mtl::rectangle<>, S, mtl::row_major>::type& A)
00104 {
00105   for(Int i=0; i<A.nrows(); i++)
00106     for(Int j=0; j<A.ncols(); j++)
00107       A[i][j] = (i!=j)?T(0):T(1);
00108 }
00109 
00110 inline void setIdentity(Matrix& A)
00111 {
00112   for(Int i=0; i<A.nrows(); i++)
00113     for(Int j=0; j<A.ncols(); j++)
00114       A[i][j] = (i!=j)?0:1;
00115 }
00116 
00117 inline void setIdentity(DenseMatrix& A)
00118 {
00119   for(Int i=0; i<A.nrows(); i++)
00120     for(Int j=0; j<A.ncols(); j++)
00121       A[i][j] = (i!=j)?0:1;
00122 }
00123 
00124 
00125 
00126 
00127 
00128 inline std::ostream& operator<<(std::ostream& out, const Matrix& m) // Output
00129 { 
00130   for(Int r=0; r<m.nrows(); r++) {
00131     for(Int c=0; c<m.ncols(); c++) {
00132       out << m(r,c) << " ";
00133     }
00134     out << "\n";
00135   }
00136   return out;
00137 }
